data.title: On Nov 6th, 1956, a ceasefire was reached in the Suez Canal conflict. Then Foreign Minister, Lester B. Pearson had mediated the peace,...
data.meta_description:
107 likes, 2 comments - vimyfoundation on November 6, 2023: "On Nov 6th, 1956, a ceasefire was reached in the Suez Canal conflict. Then Foreign Minister, Lester B. Pearson had mediated the peace, solidifying Canada's reputation as a peacekeeping nation. In recognition of his diplomatic efforts, Pearson was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1957.

Lester B. Pearson's commitment to peace had deep roots. During the First World War, he served in the Canadian Army Medical Corps and worked as a stretcher bearer on the Salonika Front in Northern Greece, gaining firsthand experience in the harsh realities of war.

//

Le 6 novembre 1956, un cessez-le-feu est conclu dans le conflit du canal de Suez. Le Premier ministre de l'époque, Lester B. Pearson, avait joué le rôle de médiateur, consolidant ainsi la réputation du Canada en tant que nation de maintien de la paix. En reconnaissance de ses efforts diplomatiques, Lester B. Pearson a reçu le prix Nobel de la paix en 1957.

L'engagement de Lester B. Pearson en faveur de la paix a des racines profondes. Pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, il a servi dans le corps médical de l'armée canadienne et a travaillé comme brancardier sur le front de Salonique, dans le nord de la Grèce, acquérant ainsi une expérience de première main des dures réalités de la guerre.

--

Lester B. Pearson serving with the Canadian Army Medical Corps, 1916. Library and Archives Canada / PA-117622".
